course: UNIV-102-01 : LETS TALK ABOUT CLIMATE CHANGE.UNIV-102-01.
question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
What changed: With each class, I learned more about a facet of climate change. I learned that the issue has lots of sides and is more complicated than what someone who has not been thoroughly educated on climate change may believe. Climate change is a social, economic, and political issue and is not as simple as global warming.
What stayed the same: the fact that a combination of technology and policy will be essential to mitigating the effects of climate change. It is less about how the individual acts and more about how big corporations behave and produce their goods.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned more about climate change in the last couple of months than I have throughout my entire life.  Out of three specific things I thought were super interesting, the first was that it would take about 400 years to return our environment to how it would've been without human activity at all.  The second thing I thought was really interesting was that droughts kill more people than floods.  Finally, the last thing I learned was that climate change can affect our lives in so many different ways that we wouldn't even imagine.

response_text: I learned how to think critically about climate change. I learned how to converse with climate skeptics and how to have meaningful discourse in the realm of climate change. I learned about climate injustice and about more technical things like geoengineering.

course: UNIV-102-01 : LETS TALK ABOUT CLIMATE CHANGE.UNIV-102-01.
question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I gained lots of knowledge in the realm of climate change and how it can be affected by so many professions.

course: UNIV-102-01 : LETS TALK ABOUT CLIMATE CHANGE.UNIV-102-01.
question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Learned about differing perspectives on climate change and how to approach conversations with climate skeptics. We also learned about other environmental considerations such as mental health in face of climate change, how people process this through art or other therapeutic forms. I was also able to learn about the private sector's growing role in combatting climate change through innovation and investments into our future.

course: UNIV-102-01 : LETS TALK ABOUT CLIMATE CHANGE.UNIV-102-01.
question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Addressing climate change is interdisciplinary; our actions as individuals matter; changing minds and convincing new people to fight climate change together is how to achieve the most outsized impact on a personal level.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
What changed: With each class, I learned more about a facet of climate change. I learned that the issue has lots of sides and is more complicated than what someone who has not been thoroughly educated on climate change may believe. Climate change is a social, economic, and political issue and is not as simple as global warming.
What stayed the same: the fact that a combination of technology and policy will be essential to mitigating the effects of climate change. It is less about how the individual acts and more about how big corporations behave and produce their goods.

course: UNIV-102-01 : LETS TALK ABOUT CLIMATE CHANGE.UNIV-102-01.
question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
What changed: With each class, I learned more about a facet of climate change. I learned that the issue has lots of sides and is more complicated than what someone who has not been thoroughly educated on climate change may believe. Climate change is a social, economic, and political issue and is not as simple as global warming.
What stayed the same: the fact that a combination of technology and policy will be essential to mitigating the effects of climate change. It is less about how the individual acts and more about how big corporations behave and produce their goods.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned more about climate change in the last couple of months than I have throughout my entire life.  Out of three specific things I thought were super interesting, the first was that it would take about 400 years to return our environment to how it would've been without human activity at all.  The second thing I thought was really interesting was that droughts kill more people than floods.  Finally, the last thing I learned was that climate change can affect our lives in so many different ways that we wouldn't even imagine.

It would be good to have the lectures have a little more of a common shared theme. Although I did learn some interesting things from some of the lectures in the “others” section, I found this section to be less useful in general.
